books.title: The Inferno
books.author: August Strindberg
books.summary: A writer succumbing to mania tries to find a path out through occultism and religion, in Strindberg’s semi-autobiographical novel.

books.title: The Triumph of the Scarlet Pimpernel
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A woman is kidnapped in order to trap her husband.

books.title: You Can’t Win
books.author: Jack Black
books.summary: Jack Black’s autobiographical account of life “on the road” as a professional thief and hobo during the late 19th century and early 20th century.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Kidnapped
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After his parents die, a young Scottish man travels to see his only remaining relative, expecting to be welcomed, but instead finds his life and liberty in grave danger.

books.title: Gentlemen Prefer Blondes
books.author: Anita Loos
books.summary: The comic diary of a young woman recounting her escapades and romances in 1920s New York and Europe.

books.title: Major Barbara
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: The story of idealistic Barbara Undershaft, a Major in the Salvation Army, who does not want to be connected to her father’s “tainted” money.

books.title: Through the Looking-Glass
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.summary: In a follow-up to her adventures in Wonderland, Alice finds herself in a mirror image of the whimsical land where she becomes a queen in her own right.

books.title: Lord Arthur Savile’s Crime and Other Stories
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A collection of Oscar Wilde’s short mysteries.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.

books.title: Lord Peter Views the Body
books.author: Dorothy L. Sayers
books.summary: A collection of short stories in which an aristocratic amateur detective solves a variety of crimes.

books.title: Representative Men
books.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
books.summary: A collection of seven lectures by Ralph Waldo Emerson on great men and their role in society.

books.title: A General View of Positivism
books.author: Auguste Comte
books.summary: A brief overview of the goals and methods of the Positivist philosophical movement.

books.title: How to Tell the Birds from the Flowers and Other Woodcuts
books.author: Robert Williams Wood
books.summary: A physicist writes and illustrates a collection of humorous poems responding to the Nature Fakers controversy.

books.title: The Devil’s Dictionary
books.author: Ambrose Bierce
books.summary: A witty, sharp collection of sardonic word definitions from the 1800s and early 1900s that provide a snapshot into the irreverent humor of early American culture.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Mack Reynolds
books.summary: A collection of science fiction short stories by Mack Reynolds ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Poirot Investigates
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A calculating Belgian detective and his wide-eyed companion investigate and solve a series of mysteries.

books.title: A Day at a Time
books.author: Archibald Alexander
books.summary: A 1916 Christian devotional reflecting on faith and morality during World War I.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.
